name: Laser_control
description: Laser for control mosquito, weed, and pest
readme_summary: The Laser_control repository details the development of a laser-based system for neutralizing mosquitoes, weeds, and pests. It uses computer vision (OpenCV, Darknet-YOLO) on a Raspberry Pi or Jetson Nano to detect targets and aims a low-power laser using galvanometer-controlled mirrors. The system is intended for outdoor use and emphasizes safety due to the potential hazards of laser technology.
key_features: Mosquito, weed, and pest neutralization using a laser
Target detection using computer vision (Haar cascades, YOLOv4-tiny)
SPI communication with DAC (mcp4922) for mirror control
Stereo vision for Y coordinate determination
Use of low-power laser pointer for safety
primary_use_case: Automated laser targeting of mosquitoes, weeds, and pests for neutralization.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a gardener in a high-tech greenhouse, using a laser pointer attached to a robotic arm to precisely target weeds among delicate plants. The robotic arm is controlled by a small screen displaying a simplified computer vision interface with bounding boxes around the weeds. The laser emits a beam of light, vaporizing the weeds. Digital particles float in the air, representing the data being processed. The repository name, 'Laser_control,' is subtly displayed on the greenhouse control panel. The scene is set in a brightly lit, futuristic greenhouse. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: DockerWakeUp
description: An intelligent Docker container management system that automatically starts containers on-demand when accessed, stops idle containers to save resources, and generates NGINX configurations for seamless reverse proxy setup
readme_summary: Docker Wake-Up is a system that automatically starts Docker containers when they are accessed via HTTP requests and stops them when idle to conserve resources. It also generates NGINX configurations for reverse proxying, including SSL setup, making it easier to manage and access Dockerized applications.
primary_use_case: Reverse proxying Dockerized applications with on-demand container startup and idle shutdown for resource conservation.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a diligent gardener tending to a garden of servers, each representing a Docker container. When a user approaches a server (container), the gardener gently waters it, causing it to spring to life with vibrant digital flowers. If a server remains untouched, the gardener prunes it back, conserving resources. A nearby control panel displays NGINX configurations, subtly integrated into the garden's design. The scene is bathed in soft, warm light, creating a sense of efficiency and care. The illustration should be in a 3D isometric style with clear details and a harmonious color palette.

name: YAPP_Box
readme_summary: YAPP_Box is an OpenSCAD project that generates customizable project boxes or enclosures. It allows users to define the dimensions of their PCB and other parameters to create a tailored enclosure with cutouts for connectors and other components.
key_features: Cutout creation on all sides (front, back, left, right, base, lid)
Ridge for base and lid overlap
primary_use_case: Creating custom enclosures for electronic projects using OpenSCAD.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan meticulously crafting a miniature house around a glowing circuit board, ensuring a perfect fit. The artisan uses digital calipers and a holographic display shows adjustable parameters like wall thickness and cutout positions. Tiny robotic arms assist, precisely placing components. The house is transparent, revealing the circuit board nestled inside. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop with subtle UI elements showing OpenSCAD code. The repository name, "YAPP_Box", is subtly etched on a nearby tool. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: siyuan
description: A privacy-first, self-hosted, fully open source personal knowledge management software, written in typescript and golang.
readme_summary: SiYuan is a privacy-first, self-hosted, fully open-source personal knowledge management system. It's built with TypeScript and Go, offering features like note-taking, knowledge base creation, and markdown support, with integrations for various services and tools.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a diligent librarian meticulously organizing scattered notes into a structured, glowing digital library. The librarian, wearing glasses and a thoughtful expression, uses a special stylus to connect ideas represented as floating orbs. Each orb contains snippets of text and images. The library shelves are lined with glowing books and subtle UI elements displaying interconnected knowledge graphs. A soft, warm light emanates from the organized knowledge, illuminating the scene. Small code snippets float in the background as subtle tech elements. The composition is clean and focused, with a color scheme of blues and greens. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: Dayflow
description: Generate a timeline of your day, automatically
readme_summary: Dayflow is a macOS application built with SwiftUI that automatically generates a timeline of your day by recording your screen activity at 1 FPS and analyzing it every 15 minutes using AI. It offers features like distraction highlights, automatic storage cleanup, and the option to use either Gemini (with your own API key) or local models (Ollama/LM Studio) for AI processing, emphasizing user privacy and data ownership.
primary_use_case: Automatically generating a timeline of daily computer activity for productivity tracking and review.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously organizing scattered notes and screenshots into a coherent timeline displayed on a large, glowing screen. The librarian uses a magnifying glass to examine each piece of information, representing the AI analysis. Digital particles flow from the screen, forming a clear and structured timeline. Small UI elements showing screen recordings and summaries are subtly integrated into the scene. The repository name, 'Dayflow,' is subtly displayed on a book spine. The scene is set in a bright, organized study with a focus on clarity and efficiency. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a calming color scheme.

name: elasticsearch
description: Free and Open Source, Distributed, RESTful Search Engine
readme_summary: Elasticsearch is a distributed search and analytics engine built on Java. It provides scalable data storage and vector database capabilities optimized for speed and relevance, enabling use cases like full-text search, logs analysis, metrics monitoring, application performance monitoring, and security log analysis.
primary_use_case: Distributed search and analytics engine for production-scale workloads.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a vast library where a diligent librarian, equipped with a glowing magnifying glass, swiftly locates specific books amidst towering shelves. The librarian represents Elasticsearch, efficiently searching through massive datasets. Each book symbolizes a piece of data, and the magnifying glass signifies the search engine's ability to pinpoint relevant information. Subtle UI elements float around the librarian, displaying search queries and results. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light, creating a sense of knowledge and discovery. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style, with rich details and a vibrant color scheme.

name: professional-programming
description: A collection of learning resources for curious software engineers
readme_summary: The repository is a curated collection of learning resources for software engineers aiming to enhance their professional skills. It covers a wide range of topics, from fundamental computer science concepts to software architecture, best practices, and career growth strategies, providing a comprehensive guide for continuous learning and development.
key_features: Curated list of must-read books and articles
Categorized resources covering various topics like algorithms, API design, career growth, and databases
Collection of resources on software engineering principles and best practices
primary_use_case: Providing a structured learning path and resources for software engineers to improve their skills and knowledge across various domains.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a grand library where each book glows with knowledge. A software engineer, represented by a focused scholar, stands at the center, selecting books from shelves labeled with key software engineering topics like 'Scalability,' 'Architecture,' and 'Best Practices.' The selected books float around the scholar, emitting particles of code and data visualizations. A subtle UI element in the background displays the repository's name. The scene is set in a warmly lit, futuristic library with a clean, organized layout. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
